snippet: Unwritten parking tickets over the last three weeks, when parking tickets dropped as much as 90 percent, accounted for about $3 million of the lost revenue.
abstract: New York City officials estimate that three-week slowdown in policing efforts following murder of two officers in Brooklyn resulted in loss of approximately $5 million from all fines; most lost revenue is result of unwritten parking tickets, which accounts for about $3 million of total.
lead_paragraph: Unwritten parking tickets over the last three weeks, when parking tickets dropped as much as 90 percent, accounted for about $3 million of the lost revenue.

headline.main: Police Slowdown Cost New York City an Estimated $5 Million in Lost Fines
headline.print_headline: Police Slowdown Over 3 Weeks Cost City Estimated $5 Million in Unwritten Tickets
